Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figure pottery oinochoe; orangey clay with white additions; exterior, cream slip: animal frieze with griffin to right, incised details on head, body and wings; filling ornament: dotted rosettes, quatrefoils, dots; bordered above by broad painted band and zig-zag.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D pl. 4, 30)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.631)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
